title:
NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang Titled As The “Best CEO of 2023”, Credits To The 
Company’s Success From AI
text: NVIDIA's CEO Jensen Huang has been titled the best "CEO" of 2023, by the British publication The Economist, citing the tremendous success in AI. Everyone here is quite aware of how NVIDIA reaped benefits from the AI hype, through its extensive product portfolio along with positioning itself from the start in a way that the firm has maintained dominance up till now. By attracting immense interest from the industry, NVIDIA created records that were never seen before, especially in terms of financial results, along with the volumes of products related to the data center segment the company shipped in FY23. Through this, NVIDIA became the first chipmaker to enter the trillion-dollar club, that too under the leadership of Jensen Huang, who played a vital role in creating the firm's success. Thanks to our employees, customers and partners for a spectacular year. — NVIDIA (@nvidia) January 4, 2024  The Economist has positioned NVIDIA's CEO on the top of the list as the best CEO of 2023, and the deciding parameters included "performance of bosses of large listed companies in the S&P 1200 index". Moreover, shareholder returns along with employee satisfaction were also taken into consideration, to ensure that the results covered key elements of a  firm, rather than just the financial results. Below Jensen comes Meta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Disco's chief executive Sekiya Kazuma, but our focus will remain on the "leather jacket" mastermind only. NVIDIA's approach since the start of 2023 has acted as a catalyst for the firm's success, mainly since the company's officials, particularly Jensen Huang, emphasized heavily on accelerating AI developments to cater to their computing needs. The firm not only introduced solutions such as the Hopper H100 AI GPU but made continuous refinements within the CUDA platform as well, which is why Team Green has seen wide industry adoption since clients are more attracted to the software side of things. This is why in a previous statement, Intel's CEO Pat Gelsinger expressed eliminating CUDA dominance "together" since it has deeply penetrated the markets. NVIDIA has the majority share of AI markets going into 2024, and the dynamics don't look to shift, at least for now, since not only has Team Green been preparing next-gen AI solutions, but has been continuously active in markets such as China, which is why they have a global superiority over the likes of AMD and Intel. Under the leadership and direction of Jensen Huang, NVIDIA seems to lead the AI bandwagon this year as well.
